page.title: 12Getting to school,N.Upottery
page.content: One of the main features of the traffic here morning and evening are the school buses.The older children, who go to Honiton or Taunton,are picked up by full-scale coaches.The younger ones,bound for the primary school at Upottery village,are either driven in by parents or picked up by a small fleet of yellow mini-buses, driven by local ladies,and parked during the day outside their cottages or farm-houses. A sore point with certain parents is that,though your child is entitled to go to school when he or she is "rising five",he or she is not entitled to a place on the school bus.
